original: 佛說摩利支天經🔽唐三藏沙門大廣智
analyzed: 佛說摩利支天經 唐三藏沙門大廣智
translated: The Buddha Speaks the Sūtra of Marici
Translated by the Trepiṭaka Master Amoghavajra of the Great Tang Dynasty, under Imperial Edict
Thus have I heard.
At one time, the Blessed One

original: 在室羅筏城逝多林給孤獨園。
analyzed: 在室羅筏城逝多林給孤獨園。
translated: was staying in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada's Park, in the city of Śrāvastī.

original: 爾時世尊告諸苾芻有天女名摩利支。
analyzed: 爾時世尊告諸苾芻有天女名摩利支。
translated: At that time, the World-Honored One told the bhikṣus, There is a celestial maiden named Marici,
who has great spiritual powers and sovereign strength.
She always walks in front of the sun and moon gods.
The sun god and moon god cannot see her,
but she can see the sun.

original: 無人能見無人能知。🔽無人能捉無人能縛。
analyzed: 無人能見無人能知。 無人能捉無人能縛。
translated: No one can see her, no one can know her,🔽no one can catch her, no one can bind her.
No one can harm her, no one can deceive her.
No one can demand her wealth,
no one can punish her.
Her enemies cannot take advantage of her.
The Buddha told the bhikṣus,

original: 若有知彼摩利支天名常憶念者。
analyzed: 若有知彼摩利支天名常憶念者。
translated: If there are those who always remember the name of Marici,

original: 彼人亦不可見亦不可知。
analyzed: 彼人亦不可見亦不可知。
translated: that person will also be invisible and unknowable.
It cannot be grasped, nor can it be bound.
It cannot be harmed, nor can it be deceived.
It will not be forced to repay debts by others.
It will not be punished by others.
It will not be taken advantage of by enemies.
If there are good men and good women,

original: 知彼摩利支天名求加護者。
analyzed: 知彼摩利支天名求加護者。
translated: Who know the name of Marici and seek her protection,
They should say this:

original: 我某甲知摩利支天母有大神力。
analyzed: 我某甲知摩利支天母有大神力。
translated: I, so-and-so, know that Marici has great divine power.
I now take refuge and wish for her to protect my body.
No one can see me.

original: 無人能知我。🔽無人能捉我。
analyzed: 無人能知我。 無人能捉我。
translated: No one can know me.🔽No one can grasp me.

original: 無人能縛我。🔽無人能害我。
analyzed: 無人能縛我。 無人能害我。
translated: No one can bind me.🔽No one can harm me.
No one can deceive me.

original: 無人能債我財物。🔽無人能責罰我。
analyzed: 無人能債我財物。 無人能責罰我。
translated: No one can force me to repay debts.🔽No one can punish me.
Enemies will not be able to take advantage of me.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke the Dharani, saying:

original: 曩謨引囉怛曩二合怛囉二合夜野一怛儞也二合
analyzed: 曩謨引囉怛曩二合怛囉二合夜野一怛儞也二合

translated: Māvati Namo saptānām

they should make this vow:

original: 王難中護我賊難中護我。
analyzed: 王難中護我賊難中護我。
translated: Protect me in the midst of royal difficulties, protect me in the midst of difficulties with thieves,

original: 行路難中護我於失道曠野中護我。
analyzed: 行路難中護我於失道曠野中護我。
translated: protect me in the midst of difficulties on the road, protect me in the wilderness when I have lost my way,

original: 水火難中護我刀兵軍陣難中護我。
analyzed: 水火難中護我刀兵軍陣難中護我。
translated: protect me in the midst of difficulties with water and fire, protect me in the midst of difficulties with swords, soldiers, and battle formations,

original: 鬼神難中護我毒藥難中護我。
analyzed: 鬼神難中護我毒藥難中護我。
translated: protect me in the midst of difficulties with ghosts and spirits, protect me in the midst of difficulties with poisonous drugs,

original: 惡獸難中護我毒蟲難中護我。
analyzed: 惡獸難中護我毒蟲難中護我。
translated: protect me in the midst of difficulties with vicious beasts, protect me in the midst of difficulties with poisonous insects,

original: 一切怨家惡人難中護我。
analyzed: 一切怨家惡人難中護我。
translated: protect me in the midst of difficulties with all enemies and evil people.

original: 佛實語護我法實語護我僧實語護我。
analyzed: 佛實語護我法實語護我僧實語護我。
translated: May the true words of the Buddha protect me, may the true words of the Dharma protect me, may the true words of the Saṃgha protect me,

original: 天實語護我仙人實語護我。
analyzed: 天實語護我仙人實語護我。
translated: may the true words of the gods protect me, may the true words of the sages protect me.
In all places and at all times,

original: 願常護我弟子某甲莎嚩二合引賀引。
analyzed: 願常護我弟子某甲莎嚩二合引賀引。
translated: Always protect me and my disciple so-and-so. Svāhā.

original: 佛告諸苾芻若善男子善女人苾芻苾芻尼。
analyzed: 佛告諸苾芻若善男子善女人苾芻苾芻尼。
translated: The Buddha told the bhikṣus, If there are good men, good women, bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs,
upāsakas, upāsikās,

original: 國王大臣一切人等有諸難時。
analyzed: 國王大臣一切人等有諸難時。
translated: kings, ministers, and all people who encounter difficulties,

original: 但當至心誦此摩利支陀羅尼。
analyzed: 但當至心誦此摩利支陀羅尼。
translated: they should sincerely recite this Dhāraṇī of Mātr­ceta.
Without waiting to exert effort, as they recite, they will accomplish it.
They will be far removed from difficulties, except for those who are not sincere.
When reciting and holding, also form the original mudrā.

original: 以香塗手先結三部心印。
analyzed: 以香塗手先結三部心印。
translated: Anoint the hands with incense, first form the heart mudrās of the three divisions.

original: 二手內相叉為拳並竪二大拇指。
analyzed: 二手內相叉為拳並竪二大拇指。
translated: Interlock the two hands inside to form a fist, with both thumbs erect.

original: 是一切如來心印真言曰。🔽唵引一爾惹以切曩爾迦半音二次結蓮部心印。
analyzed: 是一切如來心印真言曰。 唵引一爾惹以切曩爾迦半音二次結蓮部心印。
translated: This is the heart mudrā and mantra of all tathāgatas:🔽Oṃ nīrjaṇa🔽Next, form the heart mudrā of the lotus division.

original: 即前印以左大拇指屈入掌。
analyzed: 即前印以左大拇指屈入掌。
translated: The same as the previous mudrā, bend the left thumb into the palm,
and erect the right thumb. The mantra says:

original: 唵引一阿去聲引嚕引力迦半音二次結金剛部心印。
analyzed: 唵引一阿去聲引嚕引力迦半音二次結金剛部心印。
translated: Oṃ ārurakā. Next, form the heart mudrā of the vajra division.

original: 即前印以右大拇指屈入掌直竪左大拇指真言曰。
analyzed: 即前印以右大拇指屈入掌直竪左大拇指真言曰。
translated: The same as the previous mudrā, bend the right thumb into the palm and erect the left thumb straight. The mantra says:

original: 唵引一嚩日囉二合地力二合迦半音二次結護身如來拳印。
analyzed: 唵引一嚩日囉二合地力二合迦半音二次結護身如來拳印。
translated: Oṃ vajra dṛḍha kā. Next, form the protective body tathāgata fist mudrā.

original: 以右手屈大拇指橫於掌中。
analyzed: 以右手屈大拇指橫於掌中。
translated: Bend the right thumb across in the palm.

original: 便以四指握大拇指為拳。
analyzed: 便以四指握大拇指為拳。
translated: Then use the four fingers to grasp the thumb to form a fist.

original: 以此拳印加持自身五處。
analyzed: 以此拳印加持自身五處。
translated: Use this fist mudrā to empower one's own five places.

original: 先額右肩左肩心喉每處各誦真言一遍真言曰。
analyzed: 先額右肩左肩心喉每處各誦真言一遍真言曰。
translated: First, at the forehead, right shoulder, left shoulder, heart, and throat, recite the mantra once for each place. The mantra says:

original: 唵引一僕引入嚩二合羅吽引二次結摩利支菩薩根本印。
analyzed: 唵引一僕引入嚩二合羅吽引二次結摩利支菩薩根本印。
translated: Oṃ pūranī hūṃ. Next, form the fundamental mudrā of Mārichi Bodhisattva.
The two little fingers and two ring fingers,

original: 右押左內相叉。🔽直竪二頭指相捻。
analyzed: 右押左內相叉。 直竪二頭指相捻。
translated: with the right pressing on the left inside, cross each other.🔽Erect the two index fingers and touch them together.
Use the two middle fingers to wrap around the backs of the index fingers.
Bring the tips together in front.
The two thumbs are extended side by side to form the mudrā.
Form the mudrā at the heart.

original: 誦前摩利支身陀羅尼及心各七遍。
analyzed: 誦前摩利支身陀羅尼及心各七遍。
translated: Recite the Mahāmāyūrī Dhāraṇī and the mantra seven times each.
Each time, bend the two thumbs to beckon.
This is also called the welcoming and inviting mudrā.
In addition, use this mudrā to empower the five places of the body.
Disperse the mudrā above the head.
Next, form the great samaya mudrā.
Repel and bind the boundary.

original: 以右手大指捻小指甲上。
analyzed: 以右手大指捻小指甲上。
translated: With the thumb of the right hand pinching the tip of the little finger,

original: 餘三指直竪如三股杵形。
analyzed: 餘三指直竪如三股杵形。
translated: the remaining three fingers are extended straight like the shape of a three-pronged vajra.

original: 左手作金剛拳按於心上。
analyzed: 左手作金剛拳按於心上。
translated: The left hand forms a vajra fist and presses it above the heart.

original: 隨誦真言以右手印於頂上。
analyzed: 隨誦真言以右手印於頂上。
translated: Recite the mantra while tracing the mudrā on the head with the right hand.

original: 左轉三匝辟除一切作障難者。
analyzed: 左轉三匝辟除一切作障難者。
translated: Turn to the left three times to repel all those who create obstacles.
Then turn to the right three times and wave it up and down.
This will form the boundary of the ten directions.

original: 一切天龍人非人等不能附近真言曰。
analyzed: 一切天龍人非人等不能附近真言曰。
translated: All devas, nāgas, humans, non-humans, and so forth will not be able to approach. The mantra states:

original: 唵引一商迦㘑輕舌二摩訶引三去聲麼鼻聲琰娑嚩賀次結摩利支安怛袒那印此言隱形以左手虛掌作拳。
analyzed: 唵引一商迦㘑輕舌二摩訶引三去聲麼鼻聲琰娑嚩賀次結摩利支安怛袒那印此言隱形以左手虛掌作拳。
translated: Oṃ śaṅkhalikā mahā saṃyama svāhā Next, form the Mārīcī Aṅkuśa Mudrā. With the left hand, make a fist with the palm hollow.
The thumb slightly pinches the tip of the index finger nail like a ring.
The three fingers below the thumb are clenched to make a tight fist.
Also, make a hole in the palm.
Place it in front of one's heart.
Imagine one's own body entering this hole in the mudrā and hiding.
With the right hand, make a flat palm.
Rub this mudrā clockwise and then cover the hole.

original: 想此印即是摩利支天菩薩身。
analyzed: 想此印即是摩利支天菩薩身。
translated: Imagine this mudrā is the body of Bodhisattva Mārīcī.

original: 我自身隱藏於摩利支天菩薩心中。
analyzed: 我自身隱藏於摩利支天菩薩心中。
translated: One's own body is hidden in the heart of Bodhisattva Mārīcī.
Single-mindedly focus without interruption.
Recite the root and heart mantras.
No limit to the number of recitations, but with sincere and devoted mind.
One will surely receive the blessings of the bodhisattva's spiritual powers.

original: 一切怨家惡人悉不能見。
analyzed: 一切怨家惡人悉不能見。
translated: All enemies and evil people will not be able to see.
will be liberated from all calamities and difficulties.

original: 若欲供養摩利支菩薩者。
analyzed: 若欲供養摩利支菩薩者。
translated: If you wish to make offerings to Marishiten,
you should use gold, silver, red copper,

original: 或白檀香木或紫檀木等。
analyzed: 或白檀香木或紫檀木等。
translated: white sandalwood, or purple sandalwood.🔽Carve an image of Marishiten,

original: 刻作摩利支菩薩像。🔽如天女形可長半寸。
analyzed: 刻作摩利支菩薩像。 如天女形可長半寸。
translated: the size of a finger,
or one or two inches in height.
Standing or sitting on a lotus flower,

original: 頭冠瓔珞種種莊嚴極令端正。
analyzed: 頭冠瓔珞種種莊嚴極令端正。
translated: with a crown, necklace, and various adornments, extremely beautiful.
The left hand holds a celestial fan,

original: 其扇如維摩詰前天女扇。
analyzed: 其扇如維摩詰前天女扇。
translated: the fan is like the celestial fan held by the celestial maiden in front of Vimalakīrti.
The right hand hangs down, with the palm facing outward,
with the five fingers spread out, making the gesture of granting wishes.

original: 有二天女各執白拂侍立左右。
analyzed: 有二天女各執白拂侍立左右。
translated: There are two celestial maidens, each holding a white fly whisk, standing to the left and right.
When this image is completed,

original: 戴於頂上或戴臂上或置衣中。
analyzed: 戴於頂上或戴臂上或置衣中。
translated: wear it on the head, or on the arm, or place it in the clothing.

original: 以菩薩威神之力不逢災難。
analyzed: 以菩薩威神之力不逢災難。
translated: By the power of the bodhisattva's majestic spiritual virtue, one will not encounter calamities and difficulties.
One will definitely gain victory in the presence of enemies.
Evil ghosts and people will not be able to take advantage of them.

original: 若欲成驗願見摩利支天真身求勝願者。
analyzed: 若欲成驗願見摩利支天真身求勝願者。
translated: If one wishes to accomplish the verification and see the true body of Marici Devi and seek supreme vows,
recite this dharani 100,000 times.
Establish a mandala according to the Dharma.
Draw an image of Marici Bodhisattva.
Place it in the altar and make various offerings.
Also make a homa fire altar.
Marici Devi will definitely appear in her body.

original: 所求勝願決定成就除不至心。
analyzed: 所求勝願決定成就除不至心。
translated: The supreme vows that are sought will definitely be accomplished, except for those who are not sincere.
The Buddha told the bhikshus:

original: 我為當來惡世苦難恐怖有情。
analyzed: 我為當來惡世苦難恐怖有情。
translated: For the sake of sentient beings in the future evil world who are suffering, in distress, and in fear,
I will briefly explain the Dharma of Marici Devi.
This Bodhisattva has great compassion and vows.
She always protects sentient beings in places of suffering, distress, and fear,

original: 護諸有情不令天龍鬼神人及非人怨家惡獸所能為害。
analyzed: 護諸有情不令天龍鬼神人及非人怨家惡獸所能為害。
translated: so that they are not harmed by celestial dragons, ghosts, spirits, humans, or non-humans, enemies, or evil beasts.

original: 汝當受持廣宣流布饒益。
analyzed: 汝當受持廣宣流布饒益。
translated: You should uphold and widely spread this to benefit
sentient beings, the bhikshus, and the celestial dragons.🔽The bhikshus said to the Buddha:

original: 八部一切大眾聞佛所說。
analyzed: 八部一切大眾聞佛所說。
translated: The eight groups of all the great assembly, having heard what the Buddha said,
all greatly rejoiced, believed, accepted, and practiced it.
